title: Drawing, "Drawing for an Oratory (Memorial Chapel)", ca. 1820
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, blue, pink and yellow watercolor on  paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Section of a round building. A central, domed hall is surrounded by corridors.  Porticos are at left and at right.  From the latter, a staircase leads down to subterranean rooms.  A big sepulchral monument stands in the center.  Other monuments are in the main hall and the corridors.  Funerary urns stand in the niches in the basement.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Drawing for an Oratory (Memorial Chapel)", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, blue, pink and yellow watercolor on  paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3849.
